publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-1551 Shirley-Anne Somerville: Rolls of Honour of Leith Servicepersons—That the Parliament welcomes the initiative arranged by the ex-members’ association of the 1st Leith Company of the Boys’ Brigade, in conjunction with the Leith Local History Society, to have the Rolls of Honour of the Leith servicepersons available for public viewing between 30 May and 8 June 2008 at Leith Library during the Leith Festival; notes that this is the first time that this information has been on public display; further notes that relatives of the Leith servicepersons will be able to obtain a copy of relevant pages, and hopes that those with an interest in the Rolls of Honour will take this opportunity to view them.
S3M-1551 Rolls of Honour of Leith Servicepersons (lodged on 12 March 2008) Alex Neil*, Jamie Hepburn*

S3M-1551 Shirley-Anne Somerville: Rolls of Honour of Leith Servicepersons—That the Parliament welcomes the initiative arranged by the ex-members’ association of the 1st Leith Company of the Boys’ Brigade, in conjunction with the Leith Local History Society, to have the Rolls of Honour of the Leith servicepersons available for public viewing between 30 May and 8 June 2008 at Leith Library during the Leith Festival; notes that this is the first time that this information has been on public display; further notes that relatives of the Leith servicepersons will be able to obtain a copy of relevant pages, and hopes that those with an interest in the Rolls of Honour will take this opportunity to view them. Supported by: Alex Neil, Jamie Hepburn
S3M-1551 Rolls of Honour of Leith Servicepersons (lodged on 12 March 2008) Malcolm Chisholm*
